text: Answer: (a), (d) Solution: (a) Any language construct that can be defined with a regular expression can also be defined with a context-free grammar Yes it is TRUE; because every regular is CFL. (b) Any language construct that can be defined with a context-free grammar can also be defined with a regular expression It is FALSE; because every CFL is not always regular. (c) An LL(1) parser can be created for any context-free grammar If CFG is ambiguous or not left factored or._left recursive then this statement is FALSE. (d) LR parsing techniques are strictly more powerful than LL parsing techniques Yes it is TRUE
